author: kuzdogan
content: This means metadata is always written in runtime. Is this a feasible assumption? Doesn't the operation to append them to runtime code always have to be in the init code this way?

author: kuzdogan
content: AFAIK Vyper has the Vyper version metadata (not the metadata file) encoded in the runtime bytecode in CBOR

author: kuzdogan
content:
This is cumbersome in legacy bytecode, especially for nested contracts: https://docs.sourcify.dev/blog/finding-auxdatas-in-bytecode/

Having the metadata appended in respective data sections would solve that issue for runtime codes but I'm not sure how that will work with the creation code, I'm still not fully familiar with the whole creation process. 

That still assumes metadata is always appended and CBOR encoded. And I can't point out an example but making it accessible to the code doesn't feel like a good practice. If you can trick the verifier, you can easily have some code that is not visible in the verified source code https://samczsun.com/hiding-in-plain-sight/
